triples.name: Collective motion
triples.relevance: Paper proposes a new framework explaining how collective motion emerges in marching locusts through neural and consensus mechanisms.

triples.name: Self-propelled particles
triples.relevance: Paper contrasts their findings against classical self-propelled particle models from physics that cannot account for locust behavior.

triples.name: Desert locust
triples.relevance: Desert locusts are the primary study organism used to investigate collective motion through field, lab, and virtual reality experiments.

triples.name: Swarm behaviour
triples.relevance: The paper studies swarming behavior in locusts and addresses how order emerges in locust swarms that affect millions of livelihoods.

triples.name: Optomotor response
triples.relevance: Paper shows that while locusts respond to moving-dot stimuli through the optomotor response, this innate behavior does not mediate social response to neighbors.

triples.name: Collective animal behavior
triples.relevance: Paper challenges long-held beliefs about how order emerges from disorder in animal collectives through novel understanding of locust behavior.
